title: "Analysis: Sentiment Analysis of President Trump's Tweets and the SPY"
output: pdf_document 
---

# Reading in the combined Sentiment Analysis and SPY Dataframe via csv.   

```{r}
combined_df <- read.csv( '../../data/Combined_SentimentAndSPY.csv' )
summary( combined_df )
```

# Histogram of the Sentiment Score 

```{r}
hist( x    = combined_df$Sentiment.Score,
      main = "Histogram of the Sentiment Score", 
      xlab = "Sentiment Score",
      col  = 'blue' )
```


# Histogram of the Range

```{r}
hist( x    = combined_df$range,
      main = 'Histogram of Range of SPY Prices',  
      xlab = 'Range of SPY Prices',
      col  = 'red' )
```

# Log Transforming the Range Because of Skewness

```{r}
log_range <- log( combined_df$range )
hist( x    = log_range, 
      main = 'Histogram of Log of Range of SPY Prices',  
      xlab = 'Log of Range of SPY Prices',
      col  = 'red' )
```




```{r}
plot( x    = log_range, 
      y    = combined_df$Sentiment.Score,
      main = "Plot of Log Range vs. Sentiment Score",
      xlab = 'Log Range of SPY Prices',
      ylab = "Sentiment Score" )

# Draw Regression Line
regression.model <- lm( log_range ~ combined_df$Sentiment.Score ) 

abline( a   = regression.model, 
        col = 'red' )

legend( x = "topleft", 
        c("Regression Line"), 
        col = c("red"), 
        lwd = c( 2 ))
```

```{r}
cor.test( x = log_range, y = combined_df$Sentiment.Score ) 
```
